content: A rectangular garden has a width of 10 meters and a length of 25 meters. What is the area of the garden?

To find the area of a rectangle, you can use the formula:

\[
\text{area} = \text{length} \times \text{width}
\]

Given that the width is 10 meters and the length is 25 meters, you can plug these values into the formula:

\[
\text{area} = 25 \, \text{meters} \times 10 \, \text{meters} = 250 \, \text{square meters}
\]

So, the area of the garden is 250 square meters.
